attributes.comment:
Adoptive Parent - Janet Goolsby
I would like to express my concerns about the newly proposed increased fees for
filing the necessary applications required to adopt a child. Adopting a child is a
process that takes great consideration and expense. As a single parent adopting
from a foreign country it has become increasingly difficult to deal with due to time
delays in adopting a child and then for USCIS to increase its fees and penalize
those waiting parents seems a bit unfair. I feel that an organization should not be
able to profit off of something that is beyond the control of the waiting parent. I
think that increasing the fees in order to adopt a child will only increase the
problems already being face by the many children waiting for their forever families,
families not being able to afford to adopt, therefore leaving many of these children
in the system. I feel that the goal should be to find loving homes for these children
and not to profit from the delays being imposed by the foreign countries. I would
prefer to use this money to give a child a better life than to pay someone to to
reprocess an application already filed that should have been adequate in the first
place. I hope the USCIS will reconsider their proposed increased fees and think of
the children needing homes and not an increase in revenue. The goal should be to
decrease the wait time and get these children to their forever familes.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Janet K. Goolsby
